body: Wtf men have it way fucking harder. Not as smart, not as creative, completely untalented outside of the physical realm, all the responsibilities in the world while reaping none of the rewards, not allowed to complain or express the slightest emotion without being punished and told to man up, biologically hardwired to be unhappy and irritable all the time, not allowed to fail at anything even once, 3.5x higher suicide rate, depression is considered expected, use half a brain, accused of everything, conscription, the expendable and disposable sex, always the last priority for everything, the least cared about in an emergency or tragedy, allowed to be abused by women, and have to do all the brutal, dirty, crummy, laboring jobs no one wants to do, and despite having to endure more of it STILL have a higher pain sensitivity! Women and children and pets are inherently priceless, but a man is only worth what he provides. And this is all "privilege" according to the media.

author.bio_html:
https://futureconsciousness.com

+Apolitical

+Film

body:
2 month old comment, and while you raise some legitimate points I have to reply because I've seen this a few times and it's complete blackpill bullshit:

>Not as smart, not as creative, completely untalented outside of the physical realm

LMAO who the fuck do you think created civilization? Great art, music, philosophy? Women played an important part as caregivers but men were the driving creative force and the very reason for feminists whining about patriarchy. *Feminists* don't have the intelligence and creativity to create great civilizations because they see it as competition between the sexes instead of cooperation.

If you're talking about modern men or boys the jury is still out. If boys are being told they're dumber than girls then that's obvious feminist horseshit.

body: Much of the ancient creative work *was* done by women, but in those days society was extremely patriarchal so their husband or a male associate had to present it to the world because she wasn't allowed to. And if they even found out that it was her work she'd have been shamed.
